page.title: 04EXETER UNIVERSITY
page.content:
A main feature of this area is a 'by-pass' road, built by unemployed manpower during the 1930s, to be used by the{University of Exeter.
Buildings show the work of the University: The Faculties of{Science and{Arts}occupy some buildings, the {Administration}another, then there is all-important{University Library,}the {Chapel,}a club for staff members, tennis courts and a club for students, with coffee-bars,{refectory,}shops and banks.
Buildings are well designed and the surrounding{grounds}are beautiful, including a lovely pond. Hostels for students, together with houses for some members of staff, complete this area of the campus.
